Penalties for Breaching Rental Terms: What You Need to Know

July 1, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Renting office equipment like printers and copiers is a cost-effective solution for many businesses. However, just like any business agreement, rental contracts come with conditions that must be followed. Failing to comply with these conditions—whether intentionally or not—can lead to penalties for breaching rental terms.

In this article, we’ll explain what happens when you violate rental agreements, what common breaches look like, and how to avoid costly penalties. If you're currently in a copier or printer lease or considering one, understanding this topic is essential for protecting your business.

What Are Rental Terms?

Rental terms are agreed-upon conditions that govern how equipment is used, paid for, and returned. These terms include:

  • Payment schedules

  • Usage limits

  • Maintenance responsibilities

  • Duration of rental

  • Termination clauses

For a better understanding of the structure of rental conditions, read Understanding Printer Rental Conditions.

These terms are legally binding. Once signed, both the renter and the provider are expected to comply.

What Constitutes a Breach of Rental Terms?

A breach occurs when one party fails to uphold the agreement. In printer and copier rentals, this could include:

  • Late or missed payments

  • Unauthorized relocation of equipment

  • Exceeding page print limits

  • Tampering or third-party servicing without approval

  • Premature termination of the rental contract

  • Failure to return equipment in proper condition

Many breaches are avoidable. Still, it’s crucial to read every clause carefully before signing. For tips on what to look for, check Clauses in Rental Contracts.

Common Penalties for Breaching Rental Terms

Now let’s discuss the potential penalties a business might face if they violate rental agreements:

1. Late Payment Fees

The most common penalty. If you miss a due date, the provider may charge a fixed fee or a percentage-based penalty on the overdue amount.

2. Interest on Outstanding Balances

Some contracts specify interest accrual on unpaid amounts. This could accumulate monthly and significantly increase your costs.

3. Early Termination Fees

Canceling a contract before the agreed period often results in a termination penalty, typically equivalent to the remaining unpaid months or a fixed fee.

To understand how termination fees are calculated, you can refer to your specific Marga Rental Agreement.

4. Loss or Damage Charges

If equipment is returned damaged—or not at all—you may be billed for repair costs, replacement value, or both.

5. Service Violation Penalties

Attempting to repair the printer with unauthorized service providers can void warranties and trigger contractual penalties for breaching maintenance terms.

6. Legal Action or Collection Fees

In extreme cases, repeated breaches may lead to legal proceedings, including collection efforts, court involvement, and associated legal costs.

Real-World Example: Copier Rental Breach Scenario

Let’s say a small company rents a copier for 24 months. In month 10, the business moves to a new office and disconnects the equipment without notifying the provider.

What happens?

  • The provider finds the breach in relocation terms.

  • A penalty is charged for violating the location clause.

  • Early termination fees may also apply if the provider pulls out the equipment.

  • The business ends up paying more than ₱30,000 in penalties for what seemed like a small mistake.

This example shows how not knowing the rental clauses can hurt your budget. Learn how to protect yourself by reading How to Negotiate Rental Terms.

How to Avoid Penalties

✅ 1. Read Every Clause Carefully

Don’t rush. Ask questions. Understand every fee, limit, and responsibility before signing.

✅ 2. Communicate Early

If you foresee an issue—like late payment or relocation—inform your provider immediately. Some may grant extensions or adjustments.

✅ 3. Stick to the Agreed Use

Don’t exceed usage limits or tamper with the machine. Keep it in the condition stated in the agreement.

✅ 4. Request Clear Renewal Terms

Some contracts automatically renew. Others expire. Avoid confusion by reviewing your renewal terms well in advance.

✅ 5. Keep Records

Always document payments, maintenance activities, and communications. This can help you defend your case if disputes arise.

Why Do Providers Enforce Penalties?

Penalties protect the rental provider’s investment. Equipment like high-end printers can cost hundreds of thousands of pesos. Penalties help:

  • Offset the loss of income from unpaid or early-canceled contracts

  • Cover repair or replacement costs

  • Discourage careless use or neglect

It’s not about punishing renters—it’s about ensuring mutual accountability in the agreement.

Final Thoughts

Understanding the penalties for breaching rental terms is just as important as choosing the right equipment. Contracts are more than just paperwork—they are commitments with real consequences.

So, before signing a rental agreement, make sure to:

  • Know the terms.

  • Ask questions.

  • Avoid unnecessary penalties.

If you're in the process of renting office equipment, you’ll benefit from exploring these related guides:

  • Understanding Printer Rental Conditions

  • Clauses in Rental Contracts

  • How to Negotiate Rental Terms

  • Marga PH Rental Agreements

  • Renewal Terms – Marga Rental

Avoid surprises—rent smart, read carefully, and communicate clearly.
